content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Incident management on Program level\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The purpose of this Policy is to establish and enforce Incident reporting and Incident Response planning (IR Plan) as it relates to computer and non-computer related incidents, incorporating timely detection, reporting, acknowledgement, containment, root cause analysis, and closure within NBCUniversal requirements.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Customer complaints, non-compliances to any of the practices and any physical event that compromise confidentiality, security and safety shall be considered as an incident. EPAM shall report any incident associated with NBCU Projects or an occurrence observed at an NBCUniversal site to NBCUniversal Vendor Management Office. Material Incident occurrences shall be reported within 2 hours to NBCUniversal Vendor Management Office and non-material incidences within 48 hours. Vendor shall establish and maintain Incident Management framework that enables identification, reporting and management of different types of incidents to meet the NBCUniversal requirements.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Incident management on Project Level\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In case of incident, any Project member should operate according EPAM Information Security Incident Response Plan and Incident management on Program level.
